Full stack Java Engineer with an emphasis on web based technologies including HTML5, CSS3, and multiple Javascript frameworks and J2EE on the back end. I am a full stack developer using heavy front end skills on a daily basis. I also have heavy involvement with Java development using Websphere and Tomcat. I am currently using Spring on the back end, SOA for data integration using RESTful Webservices. I assist in designing and implementing responsive design for many platforms including all major modern browsers, tablets, and phones. Served as technical lead for a team of developers to redesign a critical business intranet. Redesigned and implemented a modern solution using standard web technologies including HTML, Javascript, CSS, XML, Ajax, Flash, and JSON. Server side technologies used are Java based including Java 5/6, JSPs, Struts, Hibernate, and Spring.Develops and supports a mission critical Java stand alone application used by business partners to detect fraud and scan for suspicious credit card activity. This is a fully custom J2SE application that connects to a Java based client UI that was also built in house using Java Swing. This application is multi-threaded, using a secure connection to connect to a Sybase ASE back end database using JDBC. This is a high volume, highly visibility, critical application that saves the company approximately $300,000/day.

Developed enterprise level web applications using ColdFusion and Java. Used the standard suite of web technologies including HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Ajax, JSON, and XML. Worked with various Enterprise database technologies including SQL Server, Oracle and DB2/400. Developed and supported web based reporting applications using Actuate Reporting Server. Developed mobile web application using EXT/Sencha mobile touch.

As the Digital Services Development Manager at CSAA, I had the pleasure of managing Jim for over a year.  In that time, Jim helped us to solidify our Java development practice while he delivered valuable product for our company.  Though Jim was brought on for Java development, Jim accepted task well beyond out initial request and proved he is a full stack developer.  Jim also accepted the responsibility assess our potential developers development skills and to train our incoming junior developers.  He was integral to our success and I know he will be integral to the next lucky company that has the pleasure of Jim's help.

I had the pleasure of working with Jim over the past year and a half at CSAA, during which time we spent the majority of our efforts on the flagship consumer facing product. Jim’s confidence and excellent problem solving skills helped us deliver one of the more complex features to the consumer portal in a timely manner.Additionally, Jim anchored the on-boarding team for a time. He helped improve the process for getting new developers up to speed, as well as the time that the process took. That same team was also responsible for delivering on multiple internal projects. Jim was responsible for not only developing, but also mentoring and guiding the team through multiple non-related deliverables.Jim’s abilities as a full-stack engineer and willingness to take on new technologies make him flexible enough to deliver on a range of projects, including but not limited to a range of languages such as ReactJS, NodeJS, Java and Clojure.Jim has been a leader to his peers as well as the junior developers, and a person that I have been always able to rely on. I wish James the best in his future endeavors and welcome the chance to work with him again in the future.

Problem Solver | Technologist | Senior Director of IT and Application Development COE Head at Amkor Technology

I had the pleasure of managing Jim during the majority of his time at Amkor Technology.  During his tenure, Jim proved again and again to be an invaluable member of our web development team.  As a senior engineer who rose through the ranks at Amkor, Jim had broad experience across three main areas of responsibility: new technology R&D, application development, and production support.  Because our group supported the global organization, Jim was exposed to a wide range of problem domains, tools, and technologies. Jim possesses that rare combination of technical ability, great communication skills, personality, and leadership that makes him an asset to any project.  Over the years at Amkor, Jim was instrumental in a number of projects that challenged him to learn new technologies quickly, and immediately apply that learning to the task at hand.  Jim showed great initiative, proactively identifying opportunities for the business, and turning those opportunities into applications that aligned with our corporate goals.If you have a chance to hire Jim, don't hesitate - he'll be a key member of your team before you know it.

VP Engineering at JPMorgan Chase & Co.

I hired Jim as my Lead Technical Architect in 2013 and he currently reports to me. He has proven to be a great asset to my team. Jim is in charge of our web team along with all of our web based applications. He has been instrumental in assembling this group by interviewing and hiring the members of our web team.  He has been an effective leader and mentor. Our web group has delivered several applications that are highly visible to upper management including some executives in our Phoenix and New York locations. We have achieved excellence through Jim’s guidance and leadership on several projects - many of which have had difficult challenges that had to be overcome. Jim has realized several of these projects by evaluating and making decisions on various technologies and implementing said technologies as an effective and scalable solution.Jim has demonstrated great technical acumen in the time he has been worked in my group. I have been impressed with his wide range of abilities as a technical leader by offering pragmatic solutions. Jim is my right-hand man (literally, he sits to the right of me). I can always count on him to handle critical projects and tasks without much direction or involvement. It’s really nice to have a go-to guy on my team who I can delegate work to and trust that it will get handled with the proper care and attention as if I were tending to it myself. This quality is a luxury that I appreciate and it is extremely rare in my experience. His years of experience consistently shine through. That is quite obvious with his work over the months/years he has been at American Express. Jim is a rare animal in that he is proficient in all aspects of software development. He can dig in and do the development on any given project. He can put on his Project Management hat and do the analysis, offer timelines, and perform most aspects of the SDLC. He can establish a good working relationship with clients and business partners. He can lead others and rally the troops to produce results and hit milestones. He can relate to the most introverted engineers and work well with them. And, he can also switch gears and give a presentation to a Vice President. This type of person is extremely hard to come by. One other thing that makes Jim rare is his ability to work with various technology stacks. He’s not afraid to pick up new technologies when called upon. Jim is more of a “problem solver” than a computer programmer. He’s a true IT professional and I feel fortunate to have him on my team.

James reported to me for about a year and a half.  During this time he led a team of web developers and transformed a sorely outdated website into an informative and highly functional web portal.  This website served several hundred internal users at American Express.  James' architectural vision dramatically improved both user experience and productivity.  His team remained engaged and enthusiastic throughout the project.   Jim demonstrated the core skills of a strong leader, showing proficiency in key technologies, complex problem solving, organization and prioritization of workflows, and exceptional people skills in keeping his team motivated and dedicated to the task at hand.
